intro: Raputia alba, commonly known as the white raputia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Raputia alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
